description:
There are a few unit test races in nova right now related to shelve unit tests, this one is new(ish) to me, at least not explicitly reported in launchpad:

http://logs.openstack.org/77/77477/10/check/gate-nova-python26/67243b8/console.html#_2014-08-06_12_31_54_640

Refer to the change here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b717696b5cff69e3586e06c399be7d06c057e503

That's for related bug 1349147.  That looks like a race with DB API tests and some shelve conductor task tests (integration tests).

There was also this related change trying to fix races in test_shelve:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1fb727876fff2f796de6442730527556c16a347e

That was for bug 1311778.
title: ShelveComputeManagerTestCase.test_shelve is racing

comments.content:
There are a few unit test races in nova right now related to shelve unit tests, this one is new(ish) to me, at least not explicitly reported in launchpad:

http://logs.openstack.org/77/77477/10/check/gate-nova-python26/67243b8/console.html#_2014-08-06_12_31_54_640

Refer to the change here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/b717696b5cff69e3586e06c399be7d06c057e503

That's for related bug 1349147.  That looks like a race with DB API tests and some shelve conductor task tests (integration tests).

There was also this related change trying to fix races in test_shelve:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/1fb727876fff2f796de6442730527556c16a347e

That was for bug 1311778.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Logstash on the unexpected method call part of the trace:

http://goo.gl/sxT0aK

Going further back, there are 6 hits in 10 days, all failures, check and gate.  So far only the py26 jobs.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: From looking at the subunit logs, when this fails there are nova.tests.compute.test_resource_tracker.TrackerTestCase tests running at the same time.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
The shelve test is timing out in the scheduler_rpcapi.select_destinations method, I'm wondering why we don't just stub that out, there is only one target host in unit tests.

Compare to the nova.tests.compute.test_compute tests where it stubs out the scheduler RPC API:

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/nova/tests/compute/test_compute.py#n242
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: Nevermind, the shelve tests extend test_compute.BaseTestCase so they are already stubbing out the scheduler rpcapi.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Also seeing it in test_shelve_offload:

http://logs.openstack.org/36/103436/7/check/gate-nova-python26/10ca1bc/console.html

2014-08-22 07:08:23.986 | UnexpectedMethodCallError: Unexpected method call.  unexpected:-  expected:+
2014-08-22 07:08:23.986 | - instance_update_and_get_original.__call__(<nova.context.RequestContext object at 0xa1e0150>, '30688275-3fb8-4544-a445-5c75a10f33e0', {'vm_state': 'error', 'task_state': None}) -> None
2014-08-22 07:08:23.987 | + instance_update_and_get_original.__call__(<nova.context.RequestContext object at 0xb24cc10>, 'a67dfc89-9855-4aed-acc3-e46371b053cb', {'node': None, 'vm_state': 'shelved_offloaded', 'expected_task_state': 

The e-r query needs to be updated.

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
e-r isn't reporting hits for this bug so the fingerprint might have changed, but we are still seeing this:

http://logs.openstack.org/82/126382/10/check/gate-nova-python26/8114a25/testr_results.html.gz
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
unable to reproduce using

tox -epy27 -- --until-failure  ShelveComputeManagerTestCase.test_shelve test_resource_tracker.TrackerTestCase
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo
